oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Barbara Mandrell - Part 4 and 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Barbara Mandrell (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Tape labeled part 4 and 5. Recording is from April 26, 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Barbara Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Ralph Emery and Barbara Mandrell greet the audience and joke about the first track -- (00:52) Emery inquires about Mandrell's 'sassiness' and her father -- (03:37) Mandrell and Emery introduce a Razzy Bailey track -- (04:03) Mandrell discusses how she was born in Houston, Texas and raised in California -- (05:09) Mandrell discusses her relationship to Norman Hamlet -- (05:45) Mandrell reflects on being Miss Ocean Side and other pageants -- (07:17) Emery and Mandrell discuss Mandrell's clothing choice, "Tonight," and the Whites -- (08:58) Emery has Mandrell recall a time Mandrell visited the Grand Ole Opry and why she moved to Tennessee -- (11:27) Mandrell and Emery reflect on the difficulties Mandrell faced in her pursuit of a musical career -- (12:51) Emery compares Jim Reeves to Mandrell -- (14:16) Emery and Mandrell discuss the book: Breaking into the Business -- (15:36) Emery and Mandrell imitate introductions [featuring an Unidentified jingle] -- (16:51) Emery and Mandrell introductions [featuring an Unidentified jingle] -- (17:58) Emery mentions that Mandrell plays softball with Twitty -- (20:24) Emery has Mandrell discuss Mandrell's relationship with the media -- (21:50) Emery announces Mandrell's anniversary and both discuss her wedding -- (24:00) Emery and Mandrell discuss their relationship -- (24:36) "Higher and Higher" is discussed -- (25:13) Mandrell tells a story about Willie Nelson -- (26:50) "In Times Like These" is told to be Mandrell's choice of single -- (27:27) Mandrell and Emery discuss the ability to gage an audience's response to music -- (29:09) Mandrell and Emery reflect on Sylvia -- (30:51) Emery inquires about Mandrell's upcoming television schedule -- (31:58) Emery and Mandrell discuss when Mandrell would work in the studio with B. J. Thomas -- (33:23) (Unidentified jingle) [Featuring Emery and Mandrell voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Mandrell, Barbara; Mandrell, Barbara, 1948-;
